intro: Agriphyllum echinatum, commonly known as the prickly phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of small, opposite leaves, and it produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Agriphyllum echinatum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
